intro: Lardizabala funaria, commonly known as the Andean arrowroot, is a tuberous plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its thick, starchy underground stems. The plant produces large, heart-shaped leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white. Its tubers are rich in starch and have been traditionally used as a food source by indigenous communities. The botanical features of Lardizabala funaria make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
